I've seen a lot of discussion about #scuttle-shell running in the "system tray", but many Linux users don't have a system tray. From my understanding, [GNOME Shell has deprecated them](https://blogs.gnome.org/aday/2017/08/31/status-icons-and-gnome/) and they don't seem to be coming back. I don't mean to throw a wrench in things, but is this something that's already planned for?

I saw [@greg](@JoiN9c9+xO0jgu0gg5yflTf+L1peLTBneFHjrKbmcKo=.ed25519) asked the [same question](%0Riga4Xm1PSAPK3LjmcAqn/PzCjHNJ2m/4CartMA51Y=.sha256) almost a year ago, but I could find a reply. Maybe this has already been discussed?
